formalpara.title: Figure 8. Pharyngeal phenotypes
formalpara.para: Examples of pharyngeal phenotypes: wild type WT, pharynx unattached Pun (zen-4), anterior pharynx absent Aph (aph-1) and pharynx absent Pha (pha-4). Note the full size but unattached Pun pharynx compared to the smaller than normal Aph pharynx (arrowhead). In Pha animals, no pharynx is observed (arrows). Aph animal kindly reproduced from Goutte et al. (2002).
